global.title: Global Temperature
global.explanation: GISTEMP (Goddard Institute for Space Studies Surface Temperature Analysis) data represents temperature anomalies relative to the 1951-1980 reference period. Positive values indicate temperatures above the average for this reference period.

north.title: Northern Hemisphere
north.explanation: This measurement covers all land and ocean areas north of the equator. The northern hemisphere contains most of the continental landmasses and generally shows greater variations than the southern hemisphere.

south.title: Southern Hemisphere
south.explanation: This measurement covers all land and ocean areas south of the equator. The southern hemisphere, dominated by oceans, tends to have more moderate temperature variations than the northern hemisphere.

oni.explanation: The ONI (Oceanic Ni√±o Index) measures sea surface temperature anomalies in the Ni√±o 3.4 region of the equatorial Pacific (5¬∞N-5¬∞S, 120¬∞-170¬∞W). Based on a 3-month running mean of ERSSTv5 data, the ONI uses 30-year reference periods updated every 5 years. Values ‚â• +0.5¬∞C indicate El Ni√±o conditions, ‚â§ -0.5¬∞C indicate La Ni√±a. Here, the ONI value displayed corresponds to the 3rd month of the running mean, allowing current month data to be displayed and accounting for the 2-3 month time lag between oceanic anomalies and their climatic effects.
